projects.title: Migration project at Mediq NV
projects.description:
Company description: Mediq B.V. provides medical devices, pharmaceuticals and associated care. The Company owns and operates pharmacies, wholesales pharmaceutical and medical products to community pharmacies, dispensing general practitioners, hospitals and nursing homes, and delivers drugs and medical supplies to people who receive home care.
Company turnover: € 2.65 billion, 8.300 employees 
Role: project manager.
Project budget: 250.000 euro
Staff: 8 employees/contractors
Lead a staff of eight employees/contractors of executing the analysis of big migration project in which all business applications need to be analyzed, and migrated from Merzig, Germany to Utrecht, The Netherlands.  Key accomplishments include:
•	Analyze all available business applications which are being used by the site at Merzig Germany and describe their function, the location, the infrastructure. Describe all interfaces between these business applications and the what data is related to these business applications. 
•	Document all relevant information regarding interfacing, data-usage and create a migration plan. All this documentation is input for the next phase of the project: to have installed the business applications at a new datacenter (Utrecht, The Netherlands) and to prepare for the final migration.

projects.title: Service Level Manager at Royal DSM
projects.description:
Company description: DSM is a global Life Sciences and Materials Sciences company with unique capabilities across the fields of health, nutrition, and materials. A company with annual sales of around €10 billion, locations in more than 50 countries and 24,500 employees worldwide.
Company turnover: € 9.131 billion, 21.000 employees
Role: Service Level Manager with a staff of 4 employees/contractors
In this role I acted as a service level manager who is responsible for maintaining the service level agreements between DSM and customers and to maintain contracts between DSM and suppliers. My team consisted of four network employees/contractors who were working directly under my supervision and next to that communication with other (network) departments. Key accomplishments:
-	Handling on going situation with suppliers and customers. Making sure that service levels are reached and creating reports about the delivered service. We achieved very good relationships with our customers by having frequently contact about our services.
-	Initiating and coordinating service improvement plans. Although a lot of these plans were focused on the internal organization, the customers were also affected. Therefor we asked the customer for advice which was appreciated very much and which lead to better improvement plans.
-	Business processes were described in a much better way than before, in such a way that everyone knows exactly how the organization is working. 
-	New financial overviews were created for  a better understanding how the service fee is being calculated and how to pass that on to the customers. 
-	A much better way of reporting about the services with more graphs to illustrate the current status for being able to react much faster on disturbances in the area of service management.

projects.title: Application Interfacing project at Esent (RWE Group)
projects.description:
Company description: Essent is the leading producer of sustainable energy in the Netherlands and  the largest energy company in the Netherlands. Essent is part of the RWE Group. Essent strives to provide energy using the most affordable, reliable and sustainable means possible. Company turnover: 6.3 billion euro, 3.115 employees
Role: ICT Consultant.

Acting as an ICT Consultant for the RISE Project: RWE Infrastructure for Essent.  In this project the ESSENT infrastructure business applications needed to be migrated to RWE Germany. For the ELES department it was required to have more insights about the internal and external interfaces which were used by the business applications. My achievement was to start an investigation for all interfaces and document these interfaces and describing them in such a way that the migration team did know what interfaces needed to be setup and how the test should be performed.

projects.title: Several projects at KEMBIT
projects.description:
Company description: KEMBIT is an IT innovation and Intelligence Company bases in the Europe. It aims to provide  IT solution and domain expertise as consultant and project manager to European and Global customers.  100 employee
Role: Project manager
Duties:
Miscellaneous projects:
•	For developing a new application for Contract Management document all required processes, gather and document requirements, create  functional design by application development;
•	Optimize monitoring of infrastructure components, by leading the setup of the monitoring department  by arranging the proper processes, setting up different configurations, document all environments and create the right management reports;
•	Setting up a Project Management Support Office. In this project I created a new way of dealing with the project approach within the company. What phase to deal with customers, what are the deliverables, when to sign for delivered work, how to handle financials. All these steps were displayed in one overview and a handbook in which all processes where described by using swim lanes and charts.

projects.title: Global Site Redesign project at Royal DSM
projects.description:
Company description: DSM is a global Life Sciences and Materials Sciences company with unique capabilities across the fields of health, nutrition, and materials. A company with annual sales of around €10 billion, locations in more than 50 countries and 24,500 employees worldwide.
Company turnover: € 9.131 billion, 21.000 employees
Role: project manager, Staff: 6 employees/contractors
Serving as a project manager to make sure that all running infrastructure services could be centralized. The focus was on services like File Services, Application services, print services, domain controllers and networking components. All these services are handled by each site individually. The project goal is to have these services centralized into four worldwide Wipro datacenters. Therefor a thorough requirement analysis is needed, designs (high level and detailed) needed and transition plans.

projects.title: Infrastructure projects at APG Group
projects.description:
Company description: APG is one of the largest administrators of collective pensions in the world, responsible for the administration, asset management and communication for all pensions for employees and employers in the education, construction, cleaning and window cleaning sectors, housing associations, energy and utility companies and the sheltered employment service. This adds up to more than 30,000 employers and approximately 4.5 million employees with combined pension assets of more than € 396 billion.
Role: project manager
Four projects:
•	San Server Virtualization: Virtualize (about hundred) Wintel- and AIX-servers. If not possible install the SAN boot option.
•	License Management: Implement License Management by using Enterprise Compliance Manager (ECM) from ManageSoft. Prepare all APG-servers (Wintel, AIX, Sun, Linux)  for license inventory (infra), install ECM-servers (administrator, database) and arrange the license management within the business (process)
•	KPN Mobile: Extend the internal coverage of GSM and UMTS-signals via KPN-indoor-solutions and arrange reporting of all mobile communication.
•	Secure FTP: Implement a secure environment to exchange financial data between APG and several custodians. Implementing the right software, create documentation and manuals.

projects.title: Secure Email project at APG Group
projects.description:
Company description: APG is one of the largest administrators of collective pensions in the world, responsible for the administration, asset management and communication for all pensions for employees and employers in the education, construction, cleaning and window cleaning sectors, housing associations, energy and utility companies and the sheltered employment service. This adds up to more than 30,000 employers and approximately 4.5 million employees with combined pension assets of more than € 396 billion
Role: Project manager
Projects:
•	Secure E-mail: VIPs do need to exchange e-mail messages on a secure way.
•	Situation: VIPs are using Microsoft Exchange server, Blackberry devices and Windows Mobile handhelds.
•	Secure FTP: Premiums of employers are send by media like tapes, dvd’s, cartridges) to the PGI-department. PGI would like to have this changed by sending these premiums via internet on a secure way by using Secure FTP.
	Define requirements and analyze the processes to manage the project to implement Secure E-mail by using certificates and encryption
	Start a project to develop a new product catalog (html-development). Write a projectplan and implement this new catalog.
	Write project tplan, create the funding, costs- and time plan to migrate all web-applications to a new network-infrastructure. This project touches the whole organization
	Start a project to develop a new product catalog (html-development). Write a projectplan and implement this new catalog.

Guide and support organizational improvements, by gathering, analyzing, and presenting performance data.
The Perf.Mgr. guards that processes, activities, and measurements are put in place to ensure that goals and improvements can be met in an effective and efficient manner.
profile_positions.title: Performance Manager

profile_positions.description:
Computacenter is a leading independent technology partner, trusted by large corporate and public sector organisations. We help our customers to source, transform and manage their IT infrastructure to deliver digital transformation, enabling users and their business. 

Working as Transition Manager I make sure that new services will land smoothly into our organization.
